knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: Every patient has the right to adequate relevant information regarding diagnosis, nature and cause of illness, proposed investigations and treatment, risks involved, and expected costs, explained in a language understood by the patient.
legal_meaning: Patient must be informed about illness, diagnosis, and treatment
Information must be explained in an understandable language
Expected costs must be clearly disclosed
user_friendly_explanation: You have the right to know about your illness and treatment
Doctors must explain things clearly
Hospital must tell you expected costs in advance

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: Patients have the right to access copies of medical records, case papers, and investigation reports within prescribed timelines.
legal_meaning: Patient can request medical records and reports
Hospital must provide records within prescribed timelines
user_friendly_explanation: You can ask for your medical files and reports
Hospital must give them within a fixed time
conditions: Request by patient or authorized person

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: All hospitals are duty bound to provide emergency medical care without demanding advance payment.
legal_meaning: Emergency treatment cannot be denied
Payment cannot be demanded before emergency care
user_friendly_explanation: In an emergency, hospital must treat you first
They cannot ask for money before saving your life

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: Informed consent must be obtained prior to any potentially hazardous medical procedure.
legal_meaning: Consent is mandatory before risky procedures
Risks and alternatives must be explained
user_friendly_explanation: Doctors must ask your permission before major procedures
They must explain risks before you agree

exact_citation.title: Right to Confidentiality, Human Dignity and Privacy

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: All patients have the right to privacy and confidentiality of their medical information.
legal_meaning: Medical information must be kept confidential
Patient dignity must be respected
user_friendly_explanation: Your medical details must be kept private
Hospital staff must respect your dignity
exceptions: Disclosure required by law or public health interest

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: Every patient has the right to seek a second opinion from a clinician of their choice.
legal_meaning: Patient may consult another doctor
Hospital must not obstruct this right
user_friendly_explanation: You are free to consult another doctor
Hospital must not stop you

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: Patients have the right to transparent and prominently displayed rates and itemized bills.
legal_meaning: Charges must be disclosed clearly
Bills must be itemized
user_friendly_explanation: Hospital must clearly show treatment charges
You should receive a clear bill

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: No patient shall be discriminated against on any grounds.
legal_meaning: Equal treatment must be given to all patients
user_friendly_explanation: You must not be treated unfairly
Everyone has equal patient rights

exact_citation.title: Right to Safety and Quality Care

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: Patients have the right to safe and quality health care according to established standards.
legal_meaning: Care must meet accepted safety standards
user_friendly_explanation: You have the right to safe medical care
Treatment should meet accepted standards

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: Every patient has the right to lodge complaints and seek redressal for grievances.
legal_meaning: Patient may complain against mistreatment
Hospital must have grievance mechanism
user_friendly_explanation: You can complain if you are mistreated
Hospital must listen and respond

exact_citation.document: Indian Medical Council (Professional Conduct, Etiquette and Ethics) Regulations, 2002
exact_citation.title: Obligations to the Sick

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: In case of emergency, a physician must treat the patient and shall not arbitrarily refuse treatment.
legal_meaning: Doctor must respond in emergencies
Refusal of emergency care is prohibited
user_friendly_explanation: Doctor must help in emergencies
They cannot refuse without reason

exact_citation.document: Indian Medical Council (Professional Conduct, Etiquette and Ethics) Regulations, 2002
exact_citation.title: Physician not to practice under influence

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: A physician shall not practice medicine while under the influence of alcohol or drugs.
legal_meaning: Doctor must not treat patients while intoxicated
user_friendly_explanation: Doctor must never treat patients while drunk or intoxicated

exact_citation.document: Indian Medical Council (Professional Conduct, Etiquette and Ethics) Regulations, 2002
exact_citation.title: The patient must not be neglected

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: Once a physician has undertaken a case, he shall not neglect the patient or withdraw without adequate notice.
legal_meaning: Doctor must not abandon patient care
user_friendly_explanation: Doctor cannot suddenly stop treating you

exact_citation.document: Indian Medical Council (Professional Conduct, Etiquette and Ethics) Regulations, 2002
exact_citation.title: Maintenance of Medical Records

knowledge_entries.legal_text_excerpt: Every physician shall maintain medical records and provide them within 72 hours upon request.
legal_meaning: Doctor must maintain records
Records must be provided within 72 hours
user_friendly_explanation: Doctor must keep your medical files
They must give copies within 72 hours
conditions: Request by patient or authorized person
